TopicTitle: What is so secret about this thread?! :)

Articles.Content:
Hello!

I was looking for a way to make Prilla escape system work in the current versions of the game and finally found this thread which was described so that it can help me with some updated configs.

Here is that link that I have found:

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/showthread.php/30589-LES_avionics

But whenever I click it I get a message that tells me that I do not have enough rights to see the thing!

That certainly was an extremely effective way of making me curious about the cause of the problem

What can the problem be?

If this is such a way of telling me that the thread does not exist anymore... Where can I get those files?

Or at least the idea of what do I need to do to make them myself?

Thank you!

Likely a thread that got lost in the Great Forum Apocalypse of April 2013.

Many threads and accounts died that day. A moment of silence to show our respect. *Takes off hat*

Seems like its a thread in a subforum for which you have no rights (you can't write or read in this subforum). In a forum like the KSP-forum, there are usally a few of those subforums. These are for admins, developers and other privileged to discuss things, which normal users should not be able to read.

But what exactly the subforum is and why this thread is in there, I can't tell.

This particular thread is in the 'archives' which are used to store posts that for whatever reason get lost during maintenance. In this particular case it was moved during the last restructuring of the Support forums. The thread doesn't provide you with any updated config files, but pizzaoverhead did post the following (it might help you)

Prilla is compatible with 0.20 after some cfg editing.

Add PART tag and brackets around each of the four part cfg files like this:


PART
{


...


}

You'll also need to fix the casing of two words in the cfg:

Change "category = utility" to "category = Utility" for LES_avionics.

Change "module = part" to "module = Part" for LES_abort.
